title: Using Context API to share State between components
tldr: I bet everyone who works with React on day to day basis knows what it "Props Drilling". Passing props down the component tree can become quite a burden. Hers is how Context API can solve that problem!

## Props Drilling
So here is a sample example of React component. 
![component](https://rem-blog-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/bb810891-4e6d-4175-a01a-b9df55e866b8-screen-1-png)

So as you can see, `Dashboard` is a sort of a Controller component that manages state using `React.useReducer` and passes actions down and in some cases this is absolutely fine. However as your application grows you may run into a situation when most distant child needs state or an action being passed from root parent component. 

```javascript
<RootParent>
  <NestedChild>
    <DeeperNestedChild>
      < TheDeepestChild />   <-- This component nees actions/state from root parent
    </DeeperNestedChild>
  </NestedChild>
</RootParent>
```
This is called "Props Drilling". Passing props down the component tree to child that needs it.

So, as a Developer you need to recognise moments like that and understand that maintaining that type of code in the future will be very hard. Thankfully its never too late to refactor! Well I hope... 

![refactor](https://rem-blog-bucket.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/dc8d1894-6944-4765-987c-b30ae3c227e3-refactor-time-jp)

## Context

> Context provides a way to pass data through the component tree without having to pass props down manually at every level.

Now lets see how we can refactor our example to utilise Context API.
